movesets.name: Offensive

items.name: Berry Juice
items.description: Restores 20 HP when at 50% HP or less. One-time use.

items.name: Choice Scarf
items.description: Hold item which raises Speed by 50%, but locks holder into one move.

movesets.description:
Moves

Volt Switch helps keep momentum in and out of sun. It can also help to safely bring in Chlorophyll users to sweep or Vulpix to set up sun. Thunderbolt is Helioptile's strongest attack and gives it a chance to sweep when the opponent is weakened. Dark Pulse is Helioptile's best coverage move, hitting Ghost-types for super effective damage. Hidden Power Ground and Hidden Power Grass give Helioptile a way to hit Chinchou, which would otherwise wall this set, super effectively. Hidden Power Ground hits Magnemite as well, but Hidden Power Grass hits Ground-types such as Drilbur. Hidden Power Fire gives Helioptile nearly perfect coverage, with only Deino resisting every attack. It is further boosted by sun, which is essential given its low Base Power, and hits Grass-types especially hard.

Set Details

This set functions best as an early game scout and momentum-keeper and as a late-game sweeper and revenge killer. Although Helioptile has decent Speed already, with a Choice Scarf, Helioptile outspeeds the entire unboosted metagame. It also doesn't mind being locked into a move much because of Volt Switch and its lack of good secondary options. The listed EV spread maximizes Special Attack and Speed. The remaining EVs are used to boost Helioptile's defenses. A Modest nature is recommended because Helioptile needs all the extra power it can get, but with a Timid nature, Helioptile outspeeds +1 Speed Adamant Carvanha. Between its poor defenses and Solar Power recoil, Helioptile can rarely afford to take a hit, so Berry Juice can be used instead to improve Helioptile's ability to switch into Flying-type moves.

Usage Tips

This set doesn't hit as hard as some other sun abusers, so recklessly using Thunderbolt at the start of the battle is inadvisable. That being said, Helioptile is best used early-game to deal chunks of damage while maintaining momentum and scouting out specific counters. It can be difficult to safely switch Helioptile in, but by making use of its immunities to Thunder Wave and Ghost-type moves, Helioptile can get a free switch. Helioptile is weak without the sun. As such, saving it until later in the game when the sun can be dependably set can give it a chance to deal severe damage to the opposing team. Bear in mind that Choice Scarf allows Helioptile to outspeed otherwise faster threats such as Ponyta.

Team Options

Vulpix, Larvesta, and Ponyta are good teammates, as they can set up sun for Helioptile and burn common Fighting-types. Chlorophyll users such as Oddish, Bulbasaur, and Bellsprout appreciate Helioptile's ability to threaten Fletchling and Vullaby. Knock Off support gives Helioptile a chance to sweep. Mienfoo is always a good option and forms a VoltTurn core with Helioptile. Vullaby is another fantastic choice, as it can switch into the Ground-type attacks that threaten Helioptile. Vullaby can also use STAB Flying-type attacks to threaten Timburr and Croagunk, U-turn to form a VoltTurn core with Helioptile, or Defog to eliminate Stealth Rock for Vulpix and Fire-type sun abusers. Archen has an immunity to Ground-type attacks, can use Defog to remove Stealth Rock for your team's Fire-types, carries Stealth Rock, which can help wear down opposing Flying-types, and can also use Knock Off and U-turn. Also, with Archen as a teammate, there is less pressure on Helioptile to take care of Fletchling.

moves.name: Agility
moves.description: Boosts Speed by 2 stages.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Bulldoze
moves.description: Lowers target's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Camouflage
moves.description: Changes user's type to Normal in link battles.

moves.name: Charge
moves.description: Doubles power of an Electric-type move used next turn.

moves.name: Charge Beam
moves.description: 70% chance to boost Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Cut
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Dark Pulse
moves.description: 20% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Dig
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Dragon Tail
moves.description: Forces the target to switch to a random Pokemon.

moves.name: Electric Terrain
moves.description: For five turns, Pokemon on the ground cannot fall asleep, and will be woken up if already sleeping. Their Electric-type moves are powered up by 50%.

moves.name: Electrify
moves.description: If the target is electrified before it uses a move during that turn, the target's move becomes Electric type.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Flash
moves.description: Lowers foe's accuracy 1 stage.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Glare
moves.description: Paralyzes the target.

moves.name: Grass Knot
moves.description: Deals damage based on the foe's weight.

moves.name: Hidden Power Bug
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Dark
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Light Screen
moves.description: Lowers damage from special attacks for 5 turns.

moves.name: Low Sweep
moves.description: Lowers target's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Mud-Slap
moves.description: Lowers accuracy by 1 stage.

moves.name: Parabolic Charge
moves.description: Deals damage to all adjacent targets. The user recovers half of the HP lost by the target, rounded up.

moves.name: Pound
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Psych Up
moves.description: Copies the foe's stat changes.

moves.name: Quick Attack
moves.description: The user always attacks first.

moves.name: Rain Dance
moves.description: Summons rain for 5 turns.

moves.name: Razor Wind
moves.description: Charges up the first turn; attacks on the second turn. Has a high critical hit rate.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Rock Slide
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Rock Tomb
moves.description: Lowers Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Sandstorm
moves.description: Summons a sandstorm for 5 turns.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.description: Takes 1/4 the user's max HP to create a Substitute that takes damage for the user.

moves.name: Surf
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Tail Whip
moves.description: Lowers foe's Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Thunder
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Thunder Shock
moves.description: 10% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Thunder Wave
moves.description: Paralyzes the foe.

moves.name: Thunderbolt
moves.description: 10% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: U-turn
moves.description: Attacks, then switches.

moves.name: Volt Switch
moves.description: Forces user to switch.

moves.name: Wild Charge
moves.description: Has 1/4 recoil.

abilities.name: Dry Skin
abilities.description: User absorbs Water-type attacks and has a weakness to Fire-type moves. Heals in rain and is damaged by sun.

abilities.name: Sand Veil
abilities.description: Evasion increases by 20% in a sandstorm.

abilities.name: Solar Power
abilities.description: Loses 10% HP in sun each turn. Special Attack increases by 50%.
